data.sampled: : This is a combination strategy, where the investor simultaneously sells a call option with a strike price of $90 and buys a call option with a strike price of $85. This strategy is also known as a "straddle" or "bull call spread" strategy. The objective of the investor is to profit from a price increase in the underlying asset while also limiting their potential loss to the difference between the strike prices of the call options.
